message_history.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: I would like to obtain information on the per capita health expenditure and life expectancy among residents of the five Nordic countries during the period 2020–2023 (including 2020 and 2023).

 Please present the compiled data in one Markdown table. The column headers, in order, should be: Country, Year, Per Capita Health Expenditure (EUR), Life Expectancy (Years), Domestic government health expenditure (% of GDP), Out-of-pocket expenditure (% of current health expenditure). If any data point cannot be found, please indicate it as NA.

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the column without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```.?

<think>
To construct the requested table, we need to gather specific data points for each country over the years 2020-2023. We'll start with finding the list of Nordic countries.
</think>

<search> list of nordic countries </search>

Search query: list of nordic countries
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nordic_countries):
Nordic countries - Wikipedia It includes the sovereign states of Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden; the autonomous territories of the Faroe Islands and Greenland; and the ...

[Doc 2](https://www.norden.org/en/information/facts-about-nordic-countries):
Facts about the Nordic countries The Nordic Region consists of Denmark, Norway, Sweden, Finland, and Iceland, as well as the Faroe Islands, Greenland, and Åland.

[Doc 3](https://www.britannica.com/place/Nordic-countries):
Nordic countries | Region, Number, Meaning, & vs Scandinavian Nordic countries, group of countries in northern Europe consisting of Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway, and Sweden.

The relevant Nordic countries are Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway, and Sweden. Next steps involve finding the specific yearly data for each category required. We start with health expenditure per capita.

<search> per capita health expenditure for nordic countries 2020-2023 </search>

Current health expenditure per capita (current US$) - Sweden Current health expenditure per capita, PPP (current international $) · Current health expenditure (% of GDP) · Out-of-pocket expenditure (% of current health ...

Sweden Healthcare Spending | Historical Chart & Data - Macrotrends Sweden healthcare spending per capita for 2023 was $6,152, a 3.52% increase from 2022. Sweden healthcare spending per capita for 2022 was $5,943, ...

[Doc 3](https://eurohealthobservatory.who.int/publications/i/sweden-health-system-summary):
Sweden: health system summary 2023 Current health expenditure per capita in Sweden (US$ PPP 6347) in 2020 was well above the EU average, representing 11.4% of GDP. Public ...

From these documents, I gather that Sweden's per capita health expenditure data. Similar searches will be needed for other countries.

Current health expenditure per capita (current US$) - Finland | Data Current health expenditure per capita, PPP (current international $) · Current health expenditure (% of GDP) · Out-of-pocket expenditure (% of current health ...

Finland: health system summary 2023 In 2020, Finland's health expenditure per capita was above the EU average and represented 9.6% of GDP. Out-of-pocket spending is just over 16% ...
